div.l: Lo Grenewich ther many a shrew is Inne
It were al tyme þi tale to bygynne
Now sirs qduod þis oswold þe Reve
I prey you al þat ye noght you greve
Þogh y answere and somdel sette his howue
For leflell is with force force of sowue
Þis dronken Milleward hath ytolde vs here
How þat by gyled was a Carpentere
ꝐParaventure in scorn for now I flyte
And by youre leve y shal him quyte
Right in his cherlys termes wol y speke
I prey to god his nekke mote to breke
He kan wel in myn ye seen a stalke
But in his owne he ne kan seen a balke
Here begynneth the Reues tale
At Trompyngtoıı̄un nat ferre fro Cantebrigge
Ther goth a brok and over þat a brygge
Vpon þe which broke þer stont a Mille
And þis is verray soth þat I wolle telle
A miller was þer dwellyng many a day
As eny pekok he was prout and gay
Pipen he coude and fyssch and nettes bete
And turne Cuppes and wrastelen and shete
Ay by his belt he bar a long pavade
And of a swerd ful trewchanttewchanttrewchant was þe blade
A Ioly poppere bare he in his powch
Þer was no man for ꝑperil durst him towch
A sheffeld twytel bare he in his hose
Rounde was his face and camuse was his nose
As pelled as an Ape was his skulle
He was a Market beter atte fulle
Þer durst no wight hand vpon him legge
Þat he ne swore þat he shuld a non abigge
A thef he was of corne and mele
And þat a sligh and vsant for to stele
His name was hote denoyus Symkyn
A wif he hedde comen of nobel kyn̄
Þe ꝑperson of þe town hir fader was
With hir he yaf many a panne of bras
For þat symkyn shulde in his blode a lye
